info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 11:38PM CDT until May 30 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Brown.
* WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1136 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen across northern Brown County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Early, Bangs, Blanket, Lake Brownwood State Park, Byrds, Lake Brownwood, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, May, Grosvenor, Camp Bowie, Cross Cut, Zephyr, Owens and Thrifty. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Gifford at Beaver, Austin Street at Avenue G, Belle Plain at Romines, Good Shephard at 11th, Magnolia at Belmeade, Indian Creek at 9th, Willis at Belmeade, 4th Street at Wood, Cordell at Anderson and Austin Street at Avenue J. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FRIDAY
